Package de.annalisa.loveletters.utils

Class StringHelper

java.lang.Object
de.annalisa.loveletters.utils.StringHelper
public class StringHelper extends Object
The StringHelper class provides utility methods for handling strings, text formatting, and console output in the Love Letter game.

    • splitStringAtNextSpaceAfterMaxChars

      public static String[] splitStringAtNextSpaceAfterMaxChars(String string, int maxChars)
      Splits a given string into an array of substrings, ensuring that each substring contains a maximum number of characters (or less) and does not cut words in the middle.
      Parameters:
      string - The input string to be split.
      maxChars - The maximum number of characters allowed in each substring/line.
      Returns:
      An array of substrings, each of which is less than or equal to maxChars characters in length, and words are not split in the middle. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

    • printCardsBesideEachOther

      public static String printCardsBesideEachOther(ArrayList<Card> cards)
      Combines multiple cards into a single string so that multiple cards can be displayed side by side.
      Parameters:
      cards - An arrayList of Card objects to display next to each other.
      Returns:
      A string ready to print to the console containing the cards displayed beside each other.
